intro: Lotus collinus var. cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens lotus, is a rare and unique variant of the lotus plant. It is characterized by its pale grayish-green leaves and striking pink to lavender flowers. This plant is native to specific regions in China and is often found in wetland or marshy environments. Its botanical features include a robust root system and a short, sturdy stem. The cinerascens lotus is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
